remarks.format: ## Remarks 根據預設，聽寫文法不會使用特定的單字或單字順序，以識別及解譯音訊輸入。By default, the dictation grammar does not make use of specific words or word order to identify and interpret audio input. 當內容加入至聽寫文法時，辨識引擎會使用`precedingText`和`subsequentText`來識別時解譯為聽寫的語音。When a context is added to a dictation grammar, the recognition engine uses the `precedingText` and `subsequentText` to identify when to interpret speech as dictation. > [!NOTE] > 必須載入聽寫文法或物件才能使用新增內容。A dictation grammar must be loaded by a or object before you can use to add a context. 下表說明如何辨識引擎會使用兩個參數來判斷何時要使用聽寫文法。The following table describes how the recognition engine uses the two parameters to determine when to use the dictation grammar. |`precedingText`|`subsequentText`|描述Description| |---------------------|----------------------|-----------------| |非 `null`not `null`|非 `null`not `null`|辨識引擎會使用的詞彙來括號可能的候選片語。The recognition engine uses the terms to bracket possible candidate phrases.| |`null`|非 `null`not `null`|辨識引擎會使用`subsequentText`完成聽寫。The recognition engine uses the `subsequentText` to finish dictation.| |非 `null`not `null`|`null`|辨識引擎會使用`precedingText`啟動聽寫。The recognition engine uses the `precedingText` to start dictation.| |`null`|`null`|辨識引擎使用聽寫文法時，不使用的內容。The recognition engine does not use a context when using the dictation grammar.|
